alert.note: Alert for Camp; Franklin; Morris; Red River; Titus (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 02 at 4:57PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Franklin, northern Morris, Titus, northwestern Camp and southeastern Red River Counties through 545 PM CDT... At 457 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Purley, or 8 miles north of Winnsboro, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mount Pleasant, Winnsboro, Mount Vernon, Naples, Omaha, Us 259 And I 30 Intersection, Wilkerson, Cookville, Rocky Branch, Purley, Winfield, Miller`s Cove, Rocky Mound, Hopewell, Harts Bluff, Monticello, Roeder, Harvard and Cypress. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Camp; Franklin; Morris; Red River; Titus
